content: [hakon] If they come back from the dead...
[hakon] I get your meaning.
[hakon] I see your point.
[hakon] Is that what you'd say to Vognir?
[hakon] It was dumb question.
[hakon narrator] Eyeless?
[hakon] The fewer words you say the more I'm concerned.
[hakon] Things are getting rough out here.
[hakon] Wasn't your fault.
He thinks a long while, his frown ever deepening.
[narrator] And Braggart, and Bellower, and Walker and the rest. Gods, maybe new ones.
[narrator] But we're past it now.

[narrator] Do your duty. See what is happening. Bring it to Jorundr. Don't take the whole burden on yourself, that will not make you more of a champion. That will not buy the others' respect. Doing the right thing will.
[narrator] Fine advice.

[narrator] Gunnulf was a... serious blow. The varl saved my life on more than one occasion, and I couldn't return the favor. And pray to Denglr the other territories don't hear that we lost the treasure cart.
[narrator hakon] No, I'd tell him to take on a dredge army by himself.
[narrator] I've had rougher. Not often. Probably worse still when we show up in Grofheim, empty-handed. Pray to Denglr the other territories don't hear about it.
[narrator] Now that I think on it, ironic we lost the cart right under his nose, isn't it? The gods truly are dead. I know it wasn't my fault, Hakon. It was my duty.
[narrator] Then if you want mankind and menders to throw in, keep Ludin alive and see the alliance through. Cretin though he is.
[narrator] Think for yourself. If you want to look over the side of Ridgehorn I'll come and write what I see, but... damnation. It could get out of hand. Even the Sundr could return.
[narrator] Yes.
[narrator] You're going to have to steer this ship.
{skip} mark1=hakon mark2=narrator
What do you talk about?

content.option: Think there's another war coming our way?
What would you do in my place?
I'll leave you to get ready.
